meanings.definition: To bend or lower one's body downward.
meanings.sent1: She had to astoop to pick up the fallen pen.
meanings.sent2: The gardener had to astoop to tend to the low-growing plants.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to astoop to reach the toy under the couch.
meanings.sent4: The tree seemed to astoop towards the ground under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent5: He had to astoop so low that his hands almost touched the floor.

meanings.definition: Positioned or situated in a stooping position.
meanings.sent1: The astoop figure in the painting looked like it was about to stand up.
meanings.sent2: The old man walked slowly with his astoop posture.
meanings.sent3: The astoop scarecrow in the field seemed to be nodding at the passing crows.
meanings.sent4: The astoop roof of the house gave it a quaint appearance.
meanings.sent5: The astoop statue in the park cast a long shadow in the evening sun.
